Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: A
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about: Sunburned's second album produced by Fourtet. Kieran used Sunburned as a sampler, He had us play different styles in the studio and then he took the recordings and made this album which is mainly a collage of the four day recording session. One of the band's favorite records. Cover and poster art by Raymond Pettibon, Label art by Bill Nace. Released as an LP on Ecstatic Peace in early 2010. Manhand 100.

Music played by : John Moloney, Sarah O'Shea, Taylor Richardson, Robert Thomas & Ron Schneiderman.
Album Art by Raymond Pettibon.
Label Art by Bill Nace.
Poem by Byron Coley.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: A Taste Of Never
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'I had to dish out the big bucks to get a copy of this one. I don't know how many copies there are of this album (the group are known to release the same album in different editions), but my copy which comes with a poster by band member HEXIT (MjK) is limited to only 32 copies (!!). Only two extended jams on this album, but if you like the group at their most exotic and mind-expanding, then this is not to be missed. The first track reminds me of Tago Mago-era Can, especially the Damo Suzuki-like vocal rants of the first track. The jams shift gears often enough to keep your attention throughout. At times it will pound away in your ears like a violent tribal ceremony, begging you to get up and dance yourself into a frenzied trance while at others, the music's LSD-tinged sounds will peel away your cerebral cortex so you may feast at the goo inside. Completely fried music for the completely fried individuals out there. Finger licking good stuff'
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released July 7, 2007
A Taste Of Never - Manhand 44 / Hexit / Ecstatic Yod S1 - 2007
VPRO Dutch radio sesson recorded live in the studio in Amsterdam, October 2003 during our first European Tour.
This session has 3 separate releases. The first edition on Hexit was an edition of 32 copies with a giant poster. The second was a Manhand cdr. The third was the Ecstatic Yod LP - 350 copies in letterpressed jackets and about 40 copies of hand painted artist edition copies.
Line up:
John Moloney, Robert Thomas, Rich Pontius, Phil Franklin, Marc Orleans, David Bohill, MJK, Val Webb and Chris Corsano.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Acid-X
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned Hand of the Man - Acid-X
Originally Released in 2008 on Ed Hardiman's label, Tape Drift, on cassette in a one-time edition of 100 copies. Artwork by Sarah O'Shea.
Recorded October 25, 2007 in Saarlouis, Germany.
John Moloney - Electronics & Drums
Sarah O'Shea - Electronics & Vocals
Ron Schneiderman - Guitar & Electronics
Robert Thomas - Bass & Electronics
Gozzy - Wheels / Map
Mathieu Duval's "My Record Collection" says:
If things go on this way, I'm afraid Sunburned will be releasing their albums exclusively on tape! Acid-X is a live concert performed back in October 2007 in Germany. The sound quality is above average (even better than some of the loft material!) and finds the band in a heavily drug-enhanced mood. The music on the album just oozes and drips with psylocibin-tinged noises and electro-clinks and clunks. Like legendary german hippy collective Amon Düül were they recording themselves during a particularly nasty bad LSD trip, Acid-X can sometimes show it's darker side. At one point in the song, when some initially amusing laughs suddenly turn into blood curdling screams that sound like M.I.A. being attacked by a pack of man-eating tigers, I swear I almost shit my pants. When not bent on freaking the living crap out of you, Acid-X can be a pretty trippy experience. The latter half of the album (mostly side B) is particularly kick ass and cool.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Anatomy
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned Hand of the Man - Anatomy
MH24 - originally released as a cdr in 2005.
Artwork by Robert Thomas.
The group tracks were recorded by Tony Goddess at his studio beneath the old Mystery Train Records, in Gloucester, MA, in 2002? I dont remember. This was our first time in a recording studio. The segways were done by Rob Thomas at the Loft.
From Mathieu Duval's "My Record Collection" website: "After starting off with the exact same kind of spoken word intro as on No Magic Man, I thought I would be getting something similar; instead of getting some weird and heavy stoner album, you get a pretty funky psyche album similar to the earlier Jaybird and Wildanimal. There's definitely some funk back in this album even though it is watered down and further spread apart by a few strange numbers. Some themes reoccur in different forms throughout the record; The Hand Job, The Hand Shake, The Handout and The Hand Off for example are the aforementioned spoken word bits; Eyelash and Eyelid are like a long jam separated by one weird and dreamy tune (Cavity). Some of these tracks are just plain fucked as with Facelift with it's crying samples or the similar Gland Jive and it's constant laughing. The record is quite good but it sounds pretty primitive and thin; skin and bones aesthetics."

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Archive Dive
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned Hand of the Man - Archive Dive
Water in the Zerotube - MH 196.
A various dip into the Live Archive. 2007 / 2018 / 2022.
2007 - Memory is very hazy on this one but I suspect that this is from the fried art gallery show we played on our way to SXSW.
2018 - This is a board recording from Matt Robidoux's Western Mass All-Day Fest - 07/15/2018
2022 - Excerpt from The Three Lobed Anniversary Festival - 2022. Gibbons, Ketch, Moloney, Perretta, Thomas & Schneiderman. One of the locals used our dressing room to dump a briefcase of psychedeilcs and three-letter drugs on the band (on top of the Modelo-soaked summit with Bardo Pond's Mike Gibbons) before set-time...not a good idea for rock n'roll but not bad for breathing and chanting... 04/15/2022
All tracks recorded live. Various lineups. Artwork by John Moloney.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Attica Rectangle
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'What's this? Sunburned covering The Residents? Well no, but Inside/Outside sure resembles the eye-balled ones' odd nursery rhyme and schizophrenic aesthetics. The album becomes substantially darker from the very next track onwards. Starting with Shiv Giver we are immediately dragged down into a world of horrible experiments meant to dehumanize the listener. Most of these tracks are fucked up, drone works which could very well be the sounds of elaborate machines made to calculate the spectral ratio of asylum inmates during the 40s! Attica Rectangle might be on the noisier side of the Sunburned spectrum, yet these noises are so peculiar they don't sound like anything they've ever done before! This is what it sounds like when the band is let loose in a genetic engineering lab, surrounded by surreal machinery with organic tools and mutants in glass jars. Can't wait to see the results of this experience.'

released February 15, 2008

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Banjaxed Blues
Sunburned Hand of the Man.artist: Caught on Tape: Thurston Moore & John Moloney
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Thurston Moore / John Moloney
“Banjaxed Blues”
originally relases as a double cassette edition of 40, then a single cassette and finally as a 2LP Edition of 270 Manhand / FT Records- 2014
The third live set by the improvising duo, Caught on Tape. Comprised of drummer John Moloney (Sunburned, Chelsea Light, Home Comfort, etc.) and guitarist Thurston Moore (Coachmen, Dapper, the Din, etc.), Caught On Tape is found here to be in both expansive and contractive modes. As always, much of the sonic structure involves head-birth/freak-register guitar rampagement running into caveman stomps head-on. But there are also reflective passages this time, such as the false bell sequence in “Banjaxed Blues” (a song title worthy of MV/EE). There’s even an actual song. Indeed, the hot run-through of “Staring Statues” (from Thurston’s ’95 solo album, Psychic Hearts) might even be enough to make the pop sissies out there weeping for a few minutes, before the huzz raises its beautifully ugly head once again. The gatefold cover has stickered art by Moloney, Greta Svalberg and Ted Lee. The label art is by Emma Kohlmann. The sounds are nuts. And there are 270 numbered copies, so jump like a trout or die like a dog. As always, the choice is yours. – Byron Coley, 2014

Music by Moloney, Pisani, Richardson, Capistran, Gibbons, Thomas, Schneiderman, Ketch, Turner.

trackinfo.title: Wizz With
trackinfo.about: Recorded April 30, 2022. This was recorded with an iphone at a very poorly attended show at Mystery Train Records in Amherst, MA. At the time, I felt like it was a waste of our time and energy, I was feeling cranky about taking apart the entire home studio to bring it out to this event. I was so down on it that i refused to set up drums and just dismissed the set in my head. Flash forward to Oct 9, 2022, I'm on a plane from London to Dublin, Ireland looking out the window at the white water over the Irish Sea in between Wales and Ireland and I put this on my headphones and it made the most amazing soundtrack to a beautiful plane ride. So, here it is.

trackinfo.title: A Manatee's Anvil
trackinfo.about: August 8, 2022. This was recorded on the last show of a 4 show run with Mikey Turner who was back from the UK for a visit. The tour was WEIRD but the music was very interesting and this is a fine example! Recorded outside at The Sunspot in Northampton, MA.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Blues For Game 2
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
The Sunburned clan dedicated this live recording to a {2004 World Series} baseball game between the Red Sox and Cardinals (where the Sox won 6-2 by the way). The five tracks here are all instrumental with practically no vocals. These live jams are quite funky with a touch of free jazz at times (especially on Errorful Development). It reminds me of the group's earlier efforts like Jaybird or Wildanimal; after a slew of completely fucked up releases, the collective seems to have headed back to more approachable work instead of all out noise and weirdness. This album along with Blues For Jaco had been announced on the band's website for the longest of time and I was starting to get desperate to find a copy. So I paid over thirty dollars for my copy on eBay only to see it be released not even a week later. Oh well! At least I got bonus stuff with it. The CD-R comes in a thick printed paper folded unevenly.
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released January 13, 2015
Blues For Game 2 - Manhand 22 - 2006
This is a soundboard recording from a live show at The Middle East Downstairs. Other bands on the bill were Cul De Sac and Major Stars. Because the 2004 World Series was on, and Boston hadn't made it there in a hundred years, the place was EMPTY. We had a blast though. One of Sunburned's best big band sets and a rare one with Rob on guitar for the set.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Blues For Jaco
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'Poor Jaco! It was Ron's cat and it died in a fire (which almost claimed Ron's life as well as is noted on the insert) two weeks prior to the recording of this live gig. The show took place in Dublin, Ireland and is dedicated to - you guessed it - Jaco! I must say I love the turn the band has taken with these last few recordings. They certainly kick out the jams more than they did on some of their more bizarre outings like Zample or Manhunt. It's certainly really heavy in the percussion department; the drums are downright insane at times! And when the guitar fuzz and noises join in and swell up into a frenzy of funky, heavy psych, it's practically overwhelming. The level of energy that comes out of the speakers is crazy; I couldn't possibly imagine what it must have been like to see the actual show. Some parts are so good, they even remind me of the heavier moments on that crazy Pärson Sound record.'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Bootcamp: Moses / Loft Tapes Vol. 1
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Bootcamp : Moses - 1996-1997
The Loft Tapes Volume 1 - MH 69
Originally released in 2008 as a 4 cassette box set in 2 editions of 20.
These recordings document some of the time period between Shit Spangled Banner and Rob coming up with the Sunburned band name. This material was recorded at the C.O.N. (Sunburned) Artists Loft, 7 Sherman Street, Charlestown, MA. Memories are hazy and the original liner notes are not very informative.
We used to hang out together every night, play music, drink, trip, and listen to records. Tons of people came by. In 1996, I believe that the residents of the loft were, Kristen Anderson, Rob Thomas, Angela Sawyer, Joe Malinowski, and James Coleman? I'm not sure...We were making a lot of movies around this time too, as much movies as music. This was our group therapy. Enjoy.

1. Chad Cooper, John Moloney, Robert Thomas, Dennis Norton. Recorded in 1996
2. Banjotown - Robert Thomas, Morgan, Cousin Rich, Chad Cooper, John Moloney
Tape 2: Glimpse

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Charlie's Itch
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'Sunburned have always sounded pretty out-there. Sometimes the dementia is simply way too fucked up and confusing (Zample, Weekend At Burnie's 2), while at others it is contained within a more recognizable "rock group" context (Jaybird, Double Puberty), but on some rare occasions, they seem to find a comfortable spot somewhere in between. Not since The Secret In Disguise have I found Sunburned to sound this fascinating and unique... there's simply nothing else like it in their huge output and that, to me, makes this album stand out above the rest. So what's so special about Charlie's Itch? I wouldn't even know where to begin! Try and imagine Wolf Eyes' jamming with Boards Of Canada using only garage sale toasters and a broken humidifier as their sole equipment. Electronics feature much more prominently than usual, but the way these sounds are (ab)used and the lo-fi quality of the recording make this album one hell of psychedelic mind-fuck.'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Chinese Perfume
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
Of all the recent releases by Sunburned to have come out in 2008, this is their tightest effort yet. The album is definitely more homogenous regardless off how extreme things sometimes get. Intimate Woodwork starts the album off with a bang as bizarre assorted noises come at us from all sides (imagine John Zorn's Locus Solus). Things become slightly Vibracathedral-esque on Remote Dickhead Parachute, and from then on we are pushed and shoved, back and forth as the Sunburned ones seem fit: fucked up snippets of noise (Dogfood, Baseball), old-school stoner jams (Night Exam, Chinese Perfume) and some of the most psychedelic numbers since The Secret In Disguise (Iron Language Captive is easily my favorite track on the album). The album might sound all-over-the-place at first, but there's this indiscernible theme and flow that makes this a smooth listen after repeated listens. Chinese Perfume is 2008's first must own Sunburned release!
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released January 1, 2008

This release was 100% put together by Sunburned's Rob Thomas - edits, art, titles...a recent listen was stunning because i dont remember a thing about playing this wildly psychedelic music let alone what events led to Gozzy, our legendary, heroic, and now retired driver from Leeds, to get on the mic...

Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned - Chisled
Live Burn 9 - Corsica Studios, London April 4 & August 27, 2006
2006 was a wildly busy year for us. It was the first time we played at Corsica Studios in the Elephant & Castle neighborhood of London. We had a really good time there.
April 5 was an especially wild day because we came straight from the recording session of what became Fire Escape with Kieran Hebden (fourtet) loaded in and played for another heated 3 hours.
It went so well that we came back in August to do it again.

CDs will be available in London at Cafe Oto, this Friday and here in our merch store soon.
This is dedicated to Pete Coward & Marc Orleans.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Civil Complaint
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
I was planning on getting rid of the cassette version of Civil Complaint when I purchased this CD-R edition, but seeing as how different both versions, I decided to keep both. Not sure of the differences exactly, the CD-R seems to contain the same music as the tape, but with a few extras and different edits. Regardless of the variations, I prefer the CD-R edition simply for the convenience of the media and considering that Civil Complaint finds the collective in their trippy-hippy mode, it will be listened to much more often than the tape version. The first two tracks alone make this a must have Sunburned release for all you fans out there, but having three (I believe) bonus tracks tacked on doesn't hurt either. Particularly good is the fourth untitled track which will probably make you want to try and fly (stay far away from tall buildings and ledges). CD-R comes housed in an oversized folded piece of thick paper with the same artwork found on the tape.

released February 3, 2008

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Clarity
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection" website:
" noise, cough, wheeze, honk, mongoloid grunt, kerplunk, thud, whimper, sigh, moan, whizz, scream, kisses, cries. If all these noises excite you, then this is the record for you. Add some delay effects and even more noises (like boing, twing, zip and bubble) and you know what this Sunburned Hand Of The Man record is all about (at first I thought this album was credited to the "Clear People", but Moloney confirmed it is actually a SHOTM album). They've explored similar territory before so I wasn't at all surprised to hear this particular excursion. Personally, this is not really my cup of tea; arrhythmical tribal beats, random cartoon noises and caveman grunts doesn't always do it for me (although Fantômas have excited my braincells at times doing the exact same thing). Maybe there's this top secret concept behind this record, or maybe it's just about the squink, blurble and kuff-ah."

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Closer To The Bone
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
The first double album by the Sunburned ones. There's a lot to digest here, but it's all pretty whacked-out stuff and not a dull moment in sight. There are two longer jams, both over twenty minutes long and both have this Sun Ra influence we've heard on earlier releases. One of the best tracks on here is Spinelight, with it's beautiful guitar riff which sounds like a ghostly chime over slow tribal drums and a funky bassline. Very psychedelic and contemplative. Another highlight is Wishbone. This track has a great guitar melody and junky-era John Frusciante-like vocal yelps behind thick distortion. Too bad this one is so short.'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Complexion
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'The quality of the Sunburned Hand Of The Man's discography might vary quite a bit, but when their standards are high, the results are usually amazing! This is one of those cases. Imagine yourselves Throbbing Gristle collaborating with The Doors. Things couldn't possibly get groovier then on Adult Costume, that fuzz bass is a killer! It'll have you bobbing your head and tapping your feet involuntarily. Even on the opening The Fuck Face, you get a pretty fucking decent stoner tune with slow riff and all. The fuzz bass makes a welcome comeback on The Main Vein. Much noisier this time around, but no less interesting. With Jaybird and The Secret In Disguise, Complexion completes my holy trinity of SHOTM records. I let go of my vinyl edition once Very Friendly released this on CD.'
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released June 1, 2005
Complexion - Manhand 15 / Spirit of Orr / Records / Very Friendly - 2005
Sunburned played an outdoor concert in a community garden in Somerville, Massachusetts in the summer of 2004. The show was recorded straight to mini-disc using a stereo mic. Sunburned Mike then edited it and here it is. The artist John Jagel lived in Somerville at the time and we got to go to his studio and choose the pieces for the artwork. This is a great record and a favorite of the band's. It was released first on vinyl in the USA and then cd in the UK. Currently out-of-print.
Recorded At – Somerville Community Growing Center
Mastered At – Dream Authority Music
Artwork – John Jagel (John also did artwork for Ornette Coleman's 'Ole" and other Atlantic Releases in the 1960s)

Performer – Chad Cooper, David Bohill, John Moloney, MJK, Paul Labrecque, Rich Pontius, Robert Thomas, Ron Schneiderman, Tony Goddess & Valerie Webb

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Double Puberty
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's "My Record Collection:
"FUCK YES! This record simply KICKS ASS! This is one and a half hours worth of the Sunburned clan at their improvising best. Most of the tracks found on Double Puberty (all live material) is on par with any of their earlier recordings like Jaybird or personal favorite The Secret In Disguise. If the opening track doesn't convince you of their genius, then this band is just not for you. There's a strong Sun Ra-vibe to some of these jams as clattering percussion and bizarre electronic fuckery surface through the muck. And how'bout them traumatizing vocal rants? You gotta love'em! Other tracks are heavy psych jams worthy of the most fucked up krautrock classics. Every piece here is great, but a personal favorite has to be the second track off of the second CD-R ("Holy shit!" are the only two words that come to mind). Too bad this was released as a cheap double CD-R (with horrible artwork), because this could easily have enjoyed a wider release."
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released June 1, 2006
Sunburned set sail across country on a one-way trip in May of 2006. I was staying in California after the tour to start the Howlin' Rain Tour and the rest of the band flew home. The crew was Dave Bohill, myself, Taylor Richardson, Ron Schneiderman & Keith Wood. We had a great time. Ron put together this double cdr with the intention of it being released as a double lp. Maybe that'll happen some day along with some track titles. I guess that makes this release a work in progress.I really love this one. -John Moloney 2016

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Earth Do Eagles Do
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website
'Interesting to note that an album like this, with such loud and clear references to american politics and culture, is actually a live recording from Finland (even the paper sleeve for the CD includes a crude drawing of the finnish flag, in stark contrast to the album's artwork). This album finds the sunburned bunch in deep fried, greasy rock'n'roll mode. Like a mutated cross between Motörhead and the Butthole Surfers, you can almost picture the band playing live in this sleazy highway truck stop brawl'n'grill to some toothless refrigerator-sized beardoes and wannabe cowboys. Of course, a Sunburned album wouldn't be a Sunburned album without it's fair share of pure, untamed weirdness and this can be heard on the crispy, lightly breaded Gateway Circle, the rich and buttery Rejected or the chocolaty goodness of Zorp ("I'll have a Zorp please!"). Finger licking good stuff as always. Grab a bucket of 20 before these are long gone!'
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released June 1, 2007
Earth Do Eagles Do - Manhand 45 - 2007
This is an editied board recording from Sunburned's second time playing in Tampere, Finland at a show with Circle in the summer of 2006. Its the same day that Sunburned and Circle collaborated on a recording that became the Sunburned Circle LP. We were on tour and we were well-oiled. The amazing Mick Flower of Vibracathedral Orchestra was with us on playing lead guitar. A really nice trip...
drums, bass - Phil Franklin
lead guitar - Michael Flower
sax, electronics - MJK
drums, vocals - John Moloney
lead guitar - Ron Schneiderman
bass, vocals, keys - Robert Thomas
Mathieu references the cover being a political and cultural statement but the fact of the matter is that Moloney came up with the cover by cutting up and collaging a membership flyer from the now closed-down Eagle's Nest / Men's Club / Fraternal Order in Northampton first and then Rob made a great edit of that Tampere show and we just put the 2 pieces together.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Ego Enema - MH97
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'I don't know how these guys do it, each studio or live release is nothing more than the band getting together and tirelessly improvising along the way, and yet every time, I can't seem to get tired of their unique brand of psychedelic sludge and stoner mayhem. There's always at least a few interesting elements on each release and Ego Enema is no exception. I'm not even sure if this is a live release or not, not much is mentioned on the cover and the sound quality on any Sunburned release is usually not a hint either. Except for the last track, this album (the last of 2008) finds the band in a particularly greased up, biker brawl tone. Each one is an extended jam which packs on the decibels and bpms at a frightening pace until the song eventually explodes or collapses under the weight and pressure. Only Ex Working Condition sounds more like an experimental ambient noise mess, much like a longer version of the material found on their Zample releases.'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Estey Field Organ Tone Archive Volume 11
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
The Estey Field Organ Tone Archive started with a $50 micro grant from the Brattleboro Museum & Art Center  (www.brattleboromuseum.org)  in 2013. One purpose was to build an audio catalog of Estey Field Organs that could serve as source material for others to use in connecting with sound waves.
Listening to the extended playing of a single chord, even an sonically difficult chord, creates a space where sounds build and tones collide. Resolution comes through the listener's own mind sorting out the wave patterns. Some use these recordings in their meditation, others use them for exploration into the fundamentals of sound travel. What will you find in them?
For deeper stories about the history of this technology, and the company that made them, stay tuned as more will be revealed. For now we bring you VOLUME ELEVEN in the series. This is the final chapter using this particular organ, as it has been passed to another set of hands [Pat Sansone of Wilco]. This is also the first installment to benefit from a more sophisticated recording device.
For earlier volumes of the ESTEY FIELD ORGAN TINE ARCHIVE please visit the bandcamp page at: https://esteyfieldorgantonearchive.bandcamp.com/
- Ron Schneiderman Brattleboro, VT - June 2022
This is MH190. Released on June 17, 2022.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Exile on Broadway
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned Hand of the Man - Exile on Broadway
MH176 - Archival Release - Recorded October 29, 1999
For a brief period 22 years ago, Sunburned was banished from the Loft. We had nowhere to jam. We tried out a space in Everett but it was a very short-lived ratbox.
We ended up doing a few "quiet" sessions at my triple-decker apartment at 1277 Broadway, Somerville, Ma, shared by Naomi Dooge, Cousin Rich, and myself. Eventually, jamming at the apartment ended the night we went full-blizzard because Thela's Guy Treadgold was in town from NZ and drove the third floor neighbor out of his mind. Sometime after that we got let back into the Loft. The memory is very hazy on those times.
From what I can hear on this tape, the music was played by Dave Bohill, Chad Cooper, Cousin Rich, Rob Thomas and myself. This was recorded live to cassette and never listened to until now.
Cover artwork by Rob Thomas.
John Moloney
Northampton, MA - September 2021

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: False Joker
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' Website:
'Sunburned go back to their early tribal-folk-psych roots on this live recording. Many tracks sound like they could have been from some early Butthole Surfers record with plenty of grunting, nonsensical psychobabble and weird noises to reinforce the madness on display. Not quite as chaotic as the Zample series, there are tons of groovy licks here and there, but most of it will leave you baffled. The five part Yod makes up most of the album and even though these tracks are titled the same, each one is quite different from the other. Yod 1 for example sounds like early Sunburned circa Wildanimal while Yod 5 is a completely fried jam with bizarre cartoon samples over excerpts from Beethoven's Für Elise. For those of you who like their Sunburned with a hook, look no further than Zb/Ottowa, this monster live session comes at you with blazing fury and will put you in a trance with it's pounding drums and noisy excursions.'

released September 5, 2007

Conrad Capistran, Paul Labrecque, John Moloney, Adam Noedlman, Sarah O' Shea, Robert Thomas, Ron Schneiderman

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Feel The Wind
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'At precisely twenty-five minutes in length, Outflow From Nucleus is one monster opening track, but fans of Sunburned (what ever happened to the hand?) at their heaviest will love it. The first third of the piece is structured around this incredible, repetitive bass-line riff while it's accompanied by washes of huge heavy psych jamming. The pattern then breaks apart and slows down as we crawl through zombie territory (feel free to create your own war analogies as this seems to be the theme of the recording) with deep rumbling sounds, moans and groans surrounding us. All of a sudden, a glimpse of hope, but the further we delve into the piece, the more aggressive things get as the last third of the piece falls practically in the Mainliner, louder-than-God category. This piece is followed by three much weirder (and shorter) tracks. All tracks are live (UK) so don't expect hi-fi here. I mean come on... how could you even expect that anymore!?'
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released June 1, 2007
Sunburned: Feel The Wind - Manhand 42 - 2007
This was recorded live at The Dog & Parrot, Newcastle, England in late november 2004. The bill was Sunburned, Vibracathedral Orchestra and Jazzfinger. An amazing show all around. Chad's electronics really fry the scene here in the best way.
Sunburned's line-up : Bohill, Cooper, Franklin, Gozzy, Labrecque, Moloney, Pontius, Thomas & Webb

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Fire Escape
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'When I first heard about this collaboration with Four Tet, I was thinking: "Oh no! Hebden is going to turn this into some sort of electronic album! He'll just fuck up the whole Sunburned sound!" Boy was I ever wrong! In fact, this is quite far from the remixed and reviewed album I was expecting; Kieren Hebden, even though he is the brains behind this particular album, acts more like a producer than the creator. The music is 100% Sunburned without a doubt and Hebden, who is a devout fan of the band, shows respect throughout. Imagine having a whole bunch of Sunburned's session recordings and being able to do whatever the fuck you want with them! A dream come true! Hebden obviously had tons of fun putting this all together and this rings through loud and clear on each track, from the noisier filler tracks like Captain Knowhere to the longer, pounding jams like the title track or The Wind Has Ears! Definitely some of Sunburned's best material yet!'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Formidable Circle
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Ozone Layer - Formidable Circle
Manhand 29 - 2006
In loving memory of Marc Orleans, here is his self-produced and manufactured solo record for Manhand which was released in 2006.
This was a limited, numbered edition of 300 copies. A real cd in a card-stock gatefold cd jacket with pasted on art and an informational insert. Copies are still out there and available at Fusetron and on Discogs.
This is a FREE DOWNLOAD. We thought his should be up on the page for more people to hear this amazing album.
If you'd like to donate something in Marc's name please do so on Marc's sister Laura's suggestion at:
Trout Unlimited - google it, we can't post links here.
"If you knew Marc, undoubtedly you knew about his passion for fly fishing. According to some, he had elevated the tying of flies to an art. He was a member of Trout Unlimited which works to conserve, protect and restore North America's coldwater fisheries and their watersheds."- Laura Orleans
Please read Byron Coley's words from the Wire about Marc:
"Byron Coley chronicles the life of prolific East Coast guitarist, lap steel player and chess freak Marc Orleans, of Sunburned Hand Of The Man, Spore and many more
Marc Orleans departed the planet on 25 June 2020, leaving behind a vast circle of people he had touched in a myriad of ways. Marc was a very funny guy and a true oddball, as well as being a monster musician. Originally from Maine, he spent a few academic years in the Midwest, but most of his 53 years were spent in the upper portion of the East Coast, particularly Brooklyn, where he moved to (from Boston) in the second half of the 1990s.
I had not seen Marc as much as I used to over the last few years. And that seems to have been the case with many of his old pals. His focus was intense, and during the past decade he started working seriously in the area of film production (doing both sound and camera crane operations). His musical interests had also shifted away from rock based sounds and more towards playing mandolin in the bluegrass tradition. But as I contacted various people whose arcs had collided with Marc's over the years, one thing became apparent – he was involved in more different musical ensembles and projects than just about anyone I can name.
Probably the largest chunk of the musical sub-underground knew Marc best from his decade-long tenure with the Massachusetts freak collective Sunburned Hand Of The Man. From 1997–2007 (and sporadically afterwards), he was one of Sunburned's primary members, lending his searing Gibson Firebird tone to many recordings and shows. Asked about their first meeting, Sunburned’s Rob Thomas recalled Marc as being among the very few people who actually enjoyed a show Sunburned's precursor band Shit Spangled Banner played opening for The Dirty Three (then on their debut US tour). Marc approached Rob after the set for congratulatory purposes, and the seeds for Sunburned were sown. Jams at Thomas and John Moloney's Charlestown loft were interspersed with sessions in Marc's Allston basement (where he also kept his Moog synthesizer). The original version of Sunburned consisted (at least technically) of Thomas, Moloney, Orleans, Rich Pontius, Conrad Capistran, Brian Donnelly, James Coleman and Chad Cooper. And those guys remained its core for a good long while, no matter how many other folks passed through the ranks.
During the years he was most active with Sunburned, Marc formed a trio called Fall In Love with Kyp Malone (TV On The Radio) and Kevin Shea, who played loudly and sporadically around Brooklyn for several years. He worked extensively in the experimental beard rock trio Enos Slaughter, with Dave Shuford (No Neck Blues Band) and Carter Thornton (Izititiz). He performed and recorded solo as Ozone Layer (documented on a Manhand label CD called Formidable Circle) as well as under his own name (documented on a gorgeous 8" lathe of American primitive guitar on the Moran Tape Label). Marc was also in the final version of GHQ (with Marcia Bassett, Pete Nolan and sometimes Steve Gunn), and worked with Matthew Bower in the NY iteration of Sunroof!. He also had a duo with Mick Flower (Vibracathedral Orchestra) called OF. But he was most omnipresent with Sunburned, who played far and wide, stunning the punters with their reckless abandon. Near the centre of Sunburned's vortex was Marc's enormous riffing on his trusty Firebird (and later, lap steel or dobro). Rob reports he had abandoned playing the Moog after just a few gigs.
Besides his many musical activities during this period, Marc was a madman for street hockey. No Neck Blues Band’s Keith Connolly recalls, “He’d delight in graphically recounting cross-checks given and received, a testament to his scrappy nature.” When he gave up hockey, Marc became an avid chess player.
“I remember when we were on tour with Comets On Fire,” says Moloney, “Marc would always be playing serious games with (bassist) Ben Flashman. They'd be getting out their strategy books and all that. He peaked with that around 2004, 2005.”
“Then he stopped for a while. He had to,” adds Thomas. “He was really getting obsessed with the game. I don't think he felt it was good for him anymore. But that's what he was like. Whatever he was interested in he would just focus on to the exclusion of everything else.”
At a Six Organs Of Admittance show at Free 103 in New York City circa 2003: (from left) Marc, David Keenan, Steve Gunn (background), Heather Leigh Murray, John Moloney, Brooke Sietinsons, Meg Baird. Photo courtesy of Sunburned Hand Of The Man
Prior to Sunburned, Marc had been in a loud, punky quartet called Spore, who made three albums in 1993–94, and managed to get one of Marc’s tunes onto the soundtrack of Oliver Stone's Natural Born Killers. Following this were a few loud, strange units of intense obscurity: Ambulance Driver, Pinball and Electric Bunnyhole, and a stretch concentrating on work with a great German influenced post-rock trio called Juneau, who released two exceptional albums, without causing much of a stir outside of Boston. Which set the stage for Sunburned.
Marc moved down to NYC around the time Sunburned coalesced and was a well-known figure around Brooklyn, despite the fact his main gig was in Boston. Of particular interest was a Brooklyn band he had called Eschaton, who were supposedly a very nuts space/improv unit but appear to have been witnessed solely by Thurston Moore, Chris Corsano and Keith Connolly. Other combos of this era include Ozone Swimmers (with his then wife Ela Orleans). This duo became the 3i's when Pete Nolan joined. Other units from the period include This Trouble, a trio led by Suntanama’s Darren ‘Catfish’ Zoltowski, with cellist Kirsten McCord, who recorded a still unissued single. There was also a quartet called Knot The Bottle with Connolly, Phil Franklin (Sunburned) and Wednesday Knudsen (Pigeons) After he stopped being a regular member of Sunburned, Marc still played occasional gigs with them (the last was in 2014), but his main interests were elsewhere.
Dave Shuford was starting a new, overtly country rock band called D Charles Speer & The Helix. Jason Meagher (No Neck) played bass, Robert ‘Moose’ Gregory (Suntanama) did percussion, Hans Chew (a Tennessee ex-pat also involved with the Helix's brother band Coachfingers) played piano, and Marc played lap steel, electric and resonator guitar. This led Marc into investigating the pedal steel, which he played with Meg Baird, among others. Following his appearance on Steve Gunn's Boerum Palace LP, he also formed the quartet Orleans Gunn with Steve and a rotating cast of characters. Moloney declares, “The Orleans Gunn band show at Zebulon was one of the best concerts I ever saw in NYC.” After that he turned his attention to mandolin and bluegrass, both of which he pursued avidly after being encouraged in his pursuits by the late Jack Rose (with whom The Helix toured), Marc was also involved with Brooklyn avant-country outfit Trummors. And he formed a new band with Tom Carter called Eleven Twenty Nine. Initially a duo, Eleven Twenty Nine became a trio with the addition of drummer Michael Evans of God Is My Co-Pilot.
“Eleven Twenty Nine was built around our guitar interplay,” Carter writes. “I was heavily into West Coast stuff at that time and it shows, which counterbalanced Marc's manic energy (can't remember who said, 'playing with Marc was like grappling with lightning', but that was accurate and it led to exhaustion for most people).”
Eventually, Marc started working primarily with members of NYC's bluegrass scene. This led to him forming The Gotham City Pickers with guitarist JP Gilbert and fiddler Bruno Bruzzese.
Marc's other non-musical passions included fly fishing. And as with anything that captured his interest, he went all-in. He tied flies, soaked up the literature and travelled all over the place to stand in the water and cast. He also returned to some aspects of his visual art. Marc had studied painting at the Chicago Institute of Arts and Antioch College, although friends more easily remember his meticulous work with Polaroids. But his main focus remained music: playing it, listening to it, talking about it... Marc was nothing if not persistent in his passions.
And he was a real good guy, absolutely true to who he was. And he will be missed." Byron Coley - Deerfield, MA - 2020

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Frame Slip
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Music created, engineered and mixed by Gary War & Robert Thomas in Gloucester, Massachusetts and Tapu, New Zealand September 2014-February 2015.
Drums by Kraus. Additional vocals from Clementine Nixon.
Additional cover & insert design by Taylor Richardson.
Layout by Scott Allison.
Graphics by Dalthom.
Mastered By Carl Saff.
Dalthom brings his multivarious musical NZ ex-pat weirdnesses to the party, and Thomas draws deeply on his intense Massachusetts record collector powers to create tunes and bridges and sighs that make sonic images skip across the surface of yr brain like the smoothest stone on the planet.
You can hear twinges of all kinds of heavy cult tunage smeared into the corners -- a bit or Hoelderlin here, a smudge of Relatively Clean Rivers there -- but what it most recalls are the highest echelon exploito drug-powered records like LSD Underground 12 or The Happening by Fife & Ice Ltd. As a piece of music it's as thoroughly toasted as either of those, managing to be higher key and low-key at same time. - Byron Coley

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Fuckethead
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'Don't worry, that exceedingly loud glitch during the intro to Fuckethead is intentional (and is most probably recycled from Jaybird which started similarly). You might want to turn down the volume in order to not murder your speakers. What follows is a nearly thirty-five minutes long live gig of Sunburned at their most extreme. It takes a full ten minutes of random noises and fucked up rants before any discernable beats come in. But even then, things don't get much more coherent. My first impressions were that Fuckethead is Sunburned's attempt at a Godspeed You! Black Emperor-like monster progressive tune. But of course, in the hands of Sunburned, you're lucky if you get a few seconds of actual melody. Musical madness at it's most brutish form, Fuckethead will leave few heads unturned. Even fans might do a double take before catching on. Gotta love it! As with Glik, the CD-R is housed in a single plastic shell you find in dollar stores.'
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released March 1, 2008
Fuckethead - Manhand 76 - 2008
internet quote: 'an amazing free-punk, noise-psych exorcism that leaves little room for reprieve. Frightening stuff for sure, and despite the blown fidelity, an apt recording of Sunburned at the top of their talents.'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Get Wet With The Animal
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned Hand of the Man
Get Wet With The Animal
MH 156
Winter 2018 was long, cold and rough in Western Massachusetts so we turned our practice space into a Wednesday-Night Guantanamo. Other bands would see us roll up in the van and get visibly bummed that their rehearsals were about to be annihilated. One guy even asked one of our members if we could turn down the "low end" which most likely meant the 2 hours of screaming about the DMT ANIMAL, because there was no bass guitar that night... There was a story going around the net that day stating that Johns Hopkins University was conducting a study and wanted to meet with anyone who had seen the DMT creature or alien. It made for an intriguing subject.
Get Wet With The Animal was recorded entirely at our practice space in Easthampton, MA. These Holy Grail fueled recordings are a mix of iphone and zoom recordings run through garageband, reaper and some plug-ins. We're still working on the much more listener-friendly Black Dirt session but its taking too long so in the meantime here's this. Enjoy.
Artwork by Greta Svalberg. Hand logo by Phil Franklin. Edited by John Moloney and some mastering done by Jeremy Pisani.
The cop on the cover is Boston's former police commisioner William T. Evans, who has the most immaculate Boston accent, check it out, and very well may be the Alien himself.
Scott Allison - electronics
Jen Gelineau - violin
Shannon Ketch - synth
Paul Labrecque - guitar
Ted Lee - drums, electronics, vocals
John Moloney - drums, vocals
Jeremy Pisani - guitar
Ron Schneiderman - guitar
Rob Thomas - bass

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Glak
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned - Glak - MH85
This is a closet find 'reissue' of a CDr release from around 2007 or 2008 that slipped through the cracks when I was archiving everything around 2020.
This feels to me like a companion or epilogue to our "Spacial Crime Symbol" release from around the same time - 2007 & 2008. I hear some Europe & USA tour action (probably Ithaca College 2007), basement tapes & black-hole electrojams, 2 post-punk jangle tracks from Mick Flower's house, a Moloney & Thomas chug jam from the "Weekend at Burnie's 2" session, mixed with some of Rob's spoken word experimements that were on the samplers at the time.
I have no notes on these tracks but they were played by John Moloney / Paul Labrecque / Ron Schneiderman / MJK / Robert Thomas / Taylor Richardson / Sarah O'Shea / maybe others
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection" website:
'Not sure if Glak is meant to be some sort of ode to drugs, but the opening track would have me believe so as we are given a glimpse into a casual conversation on the subject. Not only that, but most of the music that follows has that early solo John Frusciante, junky vibe to it (was Glak released to finance a drug habit as well?). Warped and bleak visions of blues, abstract vocal/noise snippets and lethargic attempts at standard rock and metal are all brought to you in a not-so-neat little package which will mostly confuse, but perhaps also amuse. The album's rock-oriented material reminds me of what Mahogany Brain might sound like were they to cover some of Gong's work (I can definitely hear some vocal similarities with Daevid Allen as well). If you enjoy Sunburned in their "anything goes" mode, you'll love Glak. CD-R comes in a slim DVD case with a printed insert.'
Cover art made in Leeds, England by Tom Greenwood, Ron Schneiderman, & John Moloney.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Glek
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's My Record Collection' website:
'Sunburned continue their series of "G" albums with this sonic oddity. Most of the five tracks on Glek are like minimalist electronic exercises; something along the lines of Perry & Kingsley could they have recorded something over fifteen thousand years ago. Synthesizers dominate throughout the album with only a few tunes using a steady drum beat for the listener to rely on. It takes a while for Krik to lift off, but once it does (about midway through), the rest of the album goes by in a flash! Piling on the strange melodies, drones and various noises for a curiously entertaining listen. Meltmen has this twisted, early Residents vibe going for it while Triangle-9 finds the jazzy elements of earlier installments bubbling up from within the muck. Some other tracks, like Bremburn, remind me of Excepter during one of their more disoriented jams (and without any vocals). Glek is for those of you who like the collective at their strangest only!'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Glik
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'Have you ever wondered what Klaus Schulze and Tangerine Dream would sound like if they were to start a band today (and were taking much more experimental drugs)? I'm sure it would sound something like Glik. Filled with bizarre synthesizer noises and fucked up drones sprinkled over a primitive beat, this is like electronic music for children born with anencephaly. Some of these tracks sound like the wilder moments on any given Sun Ra record (and is often just as insane). Just check out the free-jazz mammoth that is Tonecocker - a one-of-a-kind highlight in the band's discography. At nearly thirty-five minutes in length, it never dulls down for a second as new sounds and ideas reach our ears every few seconds. Trinsing The Atom is another highlight. A sixteen minutes excursion into all-out freak'n'roll territory. The last five minutes will literally fry your brain. The CD-R comes in a plastic single shell and is limited to only fifty copies, my copy being numero uno!'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Glok
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Matieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'The last installment in Sunburned's "G" series is even more fucked up than any of it's sister releases. Again, electronic instruments feature abundantly, like Klaus Schultze after a night of binge drinking, but it isn't rare for the band to suddenly shift towards heavier and freer territory. Although every track is meant to blend in seamlessly with each other, as if the album were one long track, there so much change going on here that Glok could easily have been divided up into hundreds of different tracks. One of the coolest moments on the album is the sudden blast of Black Sabbath/Melvins-like fury on the second track (all are untitled). The seventh track is also quite amazing with it's Add N To (X) on valium quality. This track is (of course) followed by a skeletal, upbeat no wave pop tune with Mrs. Kerry, the local church lady on the casio organ. Weird and unpredictable Sunburned schisms which will definitely please the fans.'
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released November 11, 2008
Glok - Manhand 94 - 2008
Last in the G-Vowel series. Artwork by John Moloney.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Gluk
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'Surprisingly enough, Gluk sounds nothing like any of it's sister releases (Glik & Glak). Is it any wonder why they chose to redo the cover to When The Shit Hits The Jazz? Most of the work has one foot squarely planted in the whole free jazz scene. The whole album could easily pass off as this long lost recording by Sun Ra & His Arkestra. You know those twisted home recordings where one could hear the phone in the background? I'm not used to Sunburned sounding so clearly planted in one sound throughout a record. Gluk includes everything you might expect from an old free jazz skronk fest: hyper active percussion, the occasional outburst of brass instruments like an angry dog, a chiming bell here and there or trickling piano notes to sooth the soul, tribal chanting and long passages of almost complete silence. Don't know if the band released this just to show they could actually pull it off, but the results are quite interesting and different.'
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: HAZ
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned Hand Of The Man - HAZ
Loft Tapes Volume 3 - MH93
Music recorded at the Sunburned Loft, 7 Sherman Street, Charlestown, MA, date unknown. Artwork by Sarah O'Shea. Released in 2008 on cassette in an edition of 50. Players were probably Rob Thomas, Rich Thomas, Brian Donnelly, John Moloney, Rich Pontuis, & Chad Cooper.
From Mathieu Duval's "My Record Collection" website:
'Sunburned Hand Of The Man continue their series of "loft tapes" which they started earlier this year with the quadruple tape release of Bootcamp: Moses. These are basically compilations of early material which wouldn't really fit on any album and they run the gammut from the weird to the extremely weird. For example, the first two tracks on this second volume range from a sped up version, chipmunk voices and all, of a wild gypsy folk song played by the camp fire to a sped up version of a bizarre traditional chinese folk song. It's INSANE!!! I don't know what's up with the high-pitched voices; maybe it's an early stylistic approach, maybe it's a fuck up. Whatever it is, it gives these tunes a truly creepy and deranged vibe that I had never heard from them before. Freaky late night shroom jams? Entranced incantations for lost souls? Lamentations for unknown anthropomorphic gods? The aural equivalent of salvia divinorum?'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Het Bos
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned Hand of the Man - Het Bos
Live / Burn: Volume 14 - Antwerp, Belgium
March 22, 2022 - MH206
Shannon Ketch - Vocals, Synth, Sampler
John Moloney - Drums, Vocals, Mellotron, Harmonica
Mark Perretta - Guitar, Vocals, Tapes, Harmonica
Rob Thomas - Bass (overdubbed 01/28/2024 at The Sunspot)
Mix, edits and artwork by John Moloney. The front and back photos are from the bathroom at Het Bos - which translates into english means, "The Forest."
This was one of the five shows we played on our March 2022 tour of London, Leeds, Amsterdam & Antwerp. For this show we showed up on the train from London as a trio of Mark, Shannon & myself. After the bigger band blowouts of London & Leeds, we were faced with the question of "What the hell are we going to do?" or "How is this going to work?" This is how it went. Het Bos is a beautiful and welcoming space and made it very easy for us to relax and let the music flow.
Antwerp has been very kind to Sunburned and is like a second home for us. Our old friend, Koen Vandenhoudt surprised us by being the house DJ for the night. Our booking agent Vincent Royers was there as well as a few familiar faces and some online supporters. Dennis Tyfus couldn't make it because he caught covid the week before, but it was very cool to see his old sign from the Scheldhapen hanging in the club. Koen was the first person to take the chance of bringing Sunburned to Continental Europe in 2003 by having us come to Belgie in Hasselt. Sunburned's Paul Labrecque lived in Antwerp for a while too. A lot of wet and crazed nights were had in that town.
Het Bos had the best backline for us to use and we projected some video behind us, while the set was recorded through the board. Pruulip opened the show and were great. Thanks for listening. Enjoy - JM 2024.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Hoof Trip / Plague Pipe
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's "My Record Collection" website:
"It took me five years to finally get a copy of this 7". Not having a turntable back then, vinyl releases became less of a priority for me and 7"s actually felt like a waste of time. But of course, I wouldn't be a Sunburned completist if I didn't include this one now would I? So after a fucked up transaction through Ecstatic Yod, I asked for a copy. As was expected, there's some pretty nifty Sunburned music on it. A-side's Hoof Trip would make a great alternate soundtrack to Alejandro Jodorowsky's El Topo (imagine this track during the emperor's dressing ritual scene!); clattering percussion, weird buzzing analog synths (I think) and wind chimes make this one a very hippy-like experience. Plague Pipe, on the other hand, sounds like some pretty standard early Sunburned material. It's as good as anything that made me fall in love with the band in the first place, but their sound would soon expand to new horizons and it was time to move along."

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Idgey Bath
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
From Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'Idgey Bath is a pretty strange record, even by Sunburned's standards. If I understand correctly, each track is a unique effort (or solo composition) from each member of the band. Moloney is responsible for Glass Galaxy, a solo synthesizer track with a sawtooth wave pulsating and droning away, taking our ears hostage for the duration of the track. Ubugoo on the other hand is a disjointed psychedelic noise freak out by (or led by) Sarah O'Shea with tons of itchy sounds, arbitrary guitar notes and Casio keyboard madness. Michael Flower is behind the album's unfortunately titled piece de resistance Pizza. At over twenty minutes in length, it's a pretty dreamy and hypnotic jam which could very well be the bastardized mutant offspring of a dream date with Pekka Airaksinen and Bruce Haack. Perhaps I'm wrong and I've misinterpreted the barely legible liner notes, but each track is so radically different that they all feel like unique compositions.'
Sunburned Hand of the Man.credits:
released October 1, 2008
Idgey Bath - Manhand 98 - 2008
Despite Mathieu's description, these are group recordings except for track 1 which is Moloney solo. 'Pizza' does feature Mick Flower but not by himself.. a weird record for sure. Tracks sourced from the archives at random. Artwork by John Moloney.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: III
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
All sounds created, engineered & mixed by Gary War & Robert Thomas in Gloucester & Northampton, Massachusetts from summer 2015 - autumn 2016.
Additional electronics, voices & percussion by Kris Thompson.
Additional keyboard on "Sat In Your Chair" by Jesse Gallagher.
Cover Art by Bloodworld.
Insert Graphics by Gary War.
Additional photography provided by Sam Quinn.
Mastering by Carl Saff.
LP will be available here and through Forced Exposure upon its release later in August 2021.
"This is the third LP by the duo comprised of Greg Dalton (aka Gary War) and Rob “Sunburned” Thomas, formerly known as Dalthom, but actually named whatever the pair feel like calling it. Recorded shortly before the disastrous election of 2016, it is partially filled with the darkness, paranoia and creeping dread that filled that time period. But there is also a hefty amount of the druggy, electronic ecstasis for which the duo is known (no matter their handle.)... Keyboards, strings, tubs, puckeroos, voices…all of these things were recorded in unexpected ways and places (via computers, handhelds, etc.) then welded together like pennies found inside a stack of rare private press LPs Paul Majors stole from a dollar bin in Kentucky." - Byron Coley

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Irrational Body Poem In Real Time
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned Hand Of The Man with Bill Nace
Irrational Body Poem In Real Time - MH 81
Originally released in 2008 on cassette in a forgotten small amount. Artwork by Rob Thomas.
I remember we were on tour to SXSW with Bill Nace who was supposed to play his own set this night. The drive from Memphis was so long that we showed up to the (weird) gig at Rubber Gloves with Why? & Cryptacize in Denton, Texas, right before we we were supposed to play so Bill's set got bumped and we just decided to play together. This is the sound of 10 hour van ride-rage squeezed into a 15 minute set.
Played by John Moloney, Bill Nace, Sarah O'Shea, Rob Thomas & Ron Schneiderman.
From Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
"This short, cassette-only release by the Sunburned clan starts off sounding like a torture ceremony involving R2-D2 of Star Wars fame and some three-hundred pound dominatrix. Barely audible (and much less recognizable) background noise, feedback and tumbling drums (you can forget about any semblance of rhythm here except for the occasional chugging sound) are accompanied by a series of loud, high pitched bleeps and electronic slide whistles. All of this escalates into a frenzy of harsh industrial noise. It all ends abruptly on side one... only to continue blasting away at our eardrums on the second side. Things get even uglier here as the sound becomes more and more piercing as the tune "progresses". Thank GOD the whole thing lasts less than fifteen minutes long. Dogs have gathered on the front porch! Any longer and they would have gone Night Of The Living Dead on me! For fans of Sunburned at their noisiest ONLY!"

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Jaybird
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Manhand 003 - released in 2000 on cdr and then later on QBICO as an LP.

Cover artwork by Rich Pontius.
Players: Cousin Rich / Conrad Capistran / Chad Cooper / Critter/ Dave Bohill / Phil Franklin / Brian Donnelly / John Moloney / Marc Orleans / Rich Pontius / Rob Thomas
from Robert Duvial's "My Record Collection"
This one is so incredibly groovy and psychedelic that the acid-tinged sounds almost come at you in a rainbow of colors through your speakers to tease the neurotransmitters in your already fried brain. Featherweight really lays down the mood of the album, it's combination of seventies styled keyboard jamming, flute and reverb soaked screams and yelps relaxing your muscles and taking over the part of your brain which makes you bob your head to the beat. The title track then takes advantage of the fact that you are vulnerable and lifts you up into space, making you expand, heavy and light at the same time, your mind floating among the galaxies. The bassline on this track is to die for it's so fucking amazing; and when the drums get louder and the vocals weirder as it goes along, there just ain't no turning back. The rest of the record follows the same guidelines. If you only had one record to get by this band...

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Knifelife
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website:
'weirdness for the sake of being weird. Plink-plunky keyboards and cheesy drum beats and spur-of-the-moment psycho-babble. This sounds like some bum playing his Radio Shack keyboard in a dingy metro station at three AM in a lousy part of town. Things sometimes get interesting as during the outro to Knifelife where buzzing background noises and shimmering car door alarm sounds form some sort of sci-fi alien soundtrack.'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Live Burn 13 - Penryn, Cornwall, England, 06/2008
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned Hand of The Man
Live / Burn 13 - Penryn, Cornwall, England
06/10/2008 - MH 205
This is an amazing board recording recovered from a thought-to-be-fried hard-drive. The show was at Miss Peapod's in Penryn, Cornwall, England.
The legendary Chris Grey who recorded L.Voag and The Homosexuals was working front of house this night and captured this very high fidelity recording of an especially inspired, Cornish Pasty & Fish & Chips fueled Sunburned crew. Dave Morris who went on to front Red River Dialect hosted us at his house the night before the show and we had an amazing time in Penryn.
This was our second time at Miss Peapod's on a UK & Ireland tour booked by our buddy Chiz at Qujunktions.
Players on this recording are Paul Labrecque, John Moloney, Sarah O' Shea, Robert Thomas & Ron Schneiderman. Photos, edits & artwork by John Moloney. Sunburned logo by Phil Franklin.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Live Burn 3: Les Instants Chavirés / Paris 2004
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
This is a recently unearthed tour recording by MJK. The show was at Les Instants Chavirés, Paris in 2004. We were on tour with No Neck Blues Band, this was the last show of the run.
We were trying to 'out psych' each other every night and we'd alternate who played first. Both camps had a healthy competition vibe going on (classic Boston / NY - Sox / Yankees vibes, seemed that way to me anyway). So on that tour, whoever went on second totally blew out whoever went on first. Both groups were so inspired by each other and I cant wait to get around to transferring the videos from this tour.
These were some of the best shows both groups have ever been involved in. In Paris, Sunburned went on before NNCK, and then they went and cracked the space/time continuum with one of the most insanely amazing shows i've ever seen to this day. - John Moloney, Northampton, MA 2019

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Live Burn 6: London, England 2004 & 2006
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Live Burn 6: London, England 2004 & 2006
93 Feet East, Brick Lane, May 31, 2004:
This was the first show of our May / June European Tour in 2004. We just come off a crazed US tour with Fourtet a month earlier, and a few months before that we did our first and very well-recieved tour of the UK after the big Wire article. Vibracathedral Orchesta & Jack Rose were also on the bill.
The show was wild and very LOOSE with just about all of VCO joining the Sunburned set. We've definately played better shows but this was an amazing night where we met new friends and legends like Edwin Pouncy and Pete Coward.
These were the days when we'd roll 3-4 vehicles deep to shows and fly 8-12 of us to Europe with plane ticklets fronted with my bartending money. We were new to this: we'd check in combo amps as a 'suitcase' by cutting a slit in a cardboard box so the amp handle would stick through and then watch it get manhandled by baggage handlers, Nothing broke! Traynor makes good combo amps... The days when we'd gather around and enjoy Chris Corsano's unveiling of an entire (sawed-in-half) drum kit that fit into a regular suitcase, Nights before flights preparing all the suitcases like Rambo. The days when we'd remember to pack a full-size pig megaphone for reasons now not remembered, and sell cartons Amercian cigs at the European merch tables because we saw that cigs were so expensive over there. They were a Hot Item! These were the fun days of cameras before smartphones took over our brains and negatively effected a good portion of our society...
The defunct music mag "Loose Lips Sink Ships" sent out Andrew Male to write up the show with the amazing photographer Steve Gullick, look them up... Andrew wrote the best description of this night and of Sunburned or really any band/ gig that I've ever read.
"Tramping the plastic glass underfoot, this whisperer on the right moved up close behind, hung on, swallowed, pressed into motion, cold glass against the arm, hissing through teeth, cursed the band... Coming out of the speaker, not drum / guitar shop music, but asthma wheezing, the dull thumping of horses, of bees packed and buzzing in the chest, against some comforting, somnambulant schizophrenia of sound, brain tuning in and out, ghostly voices that bear no resemblance to the viewed act, a rattlesnake caught in an iron foundry, monks on downers, all groans, eight or twelve members, Critter, Chad Cooper, Cousin Rich Thomas, Phil Franklin, Reverend John Moloney, others[*] - in a circle beating out chain-gang rhythms, led by the rhythmic bass of aged schoolboy Rob Thomas, in the centre of a stage that looks like the aftermath battle scene of some '68 hippie riot, protestors trapped in the dying control centre slowly picking up their daft instruments of wood and metal and wires, an indefinable band formed from band members in Franklin's Mint, Fisherman's Faggot[*], Shit Yourself, Faxed Head, Ghetto Breakers, a band born in 1997 from something called Shit-Spangled Banner, some abstract psychedelic free trip with frowns and roots in Peter Green's Fleetwood Mac and Cream, Funkadelic and Ash Ra Tempel, Sly and Sun Ra but made out in the dark woods by the demons and LSD... and then it starts to change, kick in, guitar, rhythm, removed from everyday reality, some sick marriage of those two Sawyer families of American myth - Mark Twain's ragged-trousered truant leading Texas Chainsaw Massacre's pallid, flesh-hungry family up from the rusty iron winter depths of their stuckboard kill-pit and into the sun, some ragged drum bugle corps reborn as artistic community, a missing mountain family sleeping with a car full of tapes, the children of John Fahey turning their dark and violent desires into a mystic broadcast on the King Biscuit Flour Hour, incomprehensible transmissions of hypnotic Native American chant and chime, a backs-of-envelope Rime Of The Ancient Mariner for a damned rat-pack brotherhood trying every combination of blast, chime, clank, slam, scream, thunk and mental-institution shout-in-the-dark in the hope that, one day, they'll maybe play the right combination of notes and all will be well and they'll eventually find their new exotic world, of white sand and bright light.
Five six years ago when everything seemed healthy, and the ultimate edge of the avant-garde was guys on lap-tops making cerebral dance music you couldn't dance to, this family didn't realise what was happening. Now this family are happier because George Bush allows people to say, "Well governments are evil, they don't even care..." This band don't even know if kids in their twenties have any idea of what happened in the sixties but maybe that's better because they'll regard that as a failure, how revolution how got co-opted so just showing someone that something can exist, that isn't pre-packaged, that they're doing something deliberately different, will help. Tonight this isn't their CDR, Mind Of A Brother from 1997, that made speakers sound like they were powered by twigs, bird-spit, and fear, but the sound you come upon in a clearing. Some people think that anyone can just get up there like those fucking jam bands for tourist scum out in New Orleans, but this is music for moving, a band elevated to a state of hyperactivity-in-public trying to inspire one guy, one woman, anyone, a band who've been around for a long time until they were sure they developed something really unique. Jackie O'Motherfucker? The No Neck Blues Band? No, Sunburned Hand Of The Man, No-one else sounds like them. It's a heavy sound, the kind of sound that leaks across floors into eager and absent mind, filling hair and clothes and mouths. The two girls smile and walk up. Did you like this, they ask. We thought it was the worst band we've ever seen, isn't that right? And she was laughing. Laughing hard. But, you know, in a good way." - Andrew Male - 2004
"If everyone liked what we were doing 'd know we were doing something terribly wrong. If Sunburned Hand of the Man rprotests anything it's reality itself. What people consider to be reality is not what reality is. It's protest against what's happening every day. We're trying to slip something under the curtain." Rob Thomas 2004
*Wikipediaen.wikipedia.org  › wiki › Faggot_(food)
Faggots are meatballs made from minced off-cuts and offal, especially pork (traditionally pig's heart, liver, and fatty belly meat or bacon) together with herbs for flavouring and sometimes added bread crumbs. It is a traditional dish in the United Kingdom, especially South and Mid Wales and the English Midlands.]
*93 Feet East was played by Michael Josef K, David Bohill, John Moloney Ron Schneiderman, Robert Thomas, Paul Labrecque, and Valerie Webb with everyone from Vibracathedral Orchestra joining in.
Corsica Studios, Elephant & Castle, Sunday August 27, 2006:
We played here twice in 2006, this is the second time. We loved this space and both times we played there were packed.
This audio which has some issues comes from the video camera that Sarah O'Shea used to film the show. A highlight reel of this video can be watched at the No Mask Required facebook event page.
Players at this show were: Mick Flower, Phil Franklin, Bridget Hayden, Michael Josef K, John Moloney, Rob Thomas, Ron Schneiderman, Keith Wood and Tom Kirton, our friend from Wales whos now the mayor of a small town there, who was supposed to do sound that night but bailed and joined us on stage.
Original Photo by Steve Gallick, logo by Phil Franklin, design / layout by Sarah Gibbons & John Moloney.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Live in Shit
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's 'My Record Collection' website
'A second tour only CD-R which was released at the same time as Knifelife. The music here is more disturbing and gloomy, sometimes bordering on drone. The cover art was apparently taken in part from drawings by a homeless person and the overall feeling of the record is that of despair. It's so primitive and bare and actually sounds like it could have been created by a bunch of hairy bums who were jamming with found instruments. It certainly doesn't make any sense on a whole (not that that was ever a pre-requisite for SHOTM releases!). The perfect soundtrack to shooting up or smoking crack cocaine if there ever was one. You'll probably want to take a shower after listing to it. The last track, Drizzled reminded me a bit of a track by the Butthole Surfers entitled Jimi. It certainly conjures up the same disturbing atmosphere.'

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: London Zero
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
Sunburned hand of the Man - London Zero
MH89 / Three Lobed Recordings 065
Originally released as a bonus cd that came with the Three Lobed double LP titled "A Grand Tour of Tunisia."
This cd captures 2 wild performances by Sunburned in London in 2008. The first half is from our London ICA show where we did a multimedia performance art piece with a video wall and live sculpture. We really loved this performance and to me, it stands out as the peak of what we were doing around 2008. (JM)
The second performance was us opening up for Fourtet / Burial and a few others. We were invited by Kieran (fourtet) to participate in this massive show at the 02 arena (where Led Zep just had their final show). They flew us over for one show. We played the show and then spent the week up at Mick's in Leeds just recording and hanging around the kitchen table.

Sunburned Hand of the Man.title: Magnetic Drugs
Sunburned Hand of the Man.about:
from Mathieu Duval's "My Record Collection" website
"What is there to say about an album which starts with a track like The Overt Statuette, an exercise in strangeness, there's no beat or melody in sight, just bizarre, unidentifiable noises. Very unusual when compared to the psychedelic jams we're used to, but that's just proof that the Sunburned collective are an unpredictable bunch, always trying to break new ground. It's funny to hear a group like NNCK trying to sound exactly like this on their later releases, knowing full well that Sunburned Man Of The Hand were doing these same sounds a few years before. Electronic sounds have taken a bigger role on this record which finds the collective leaning more towards the weirder side of their sound. The eighteen-minute-long The Soft Hustle is an interesting bit of hysteria as crazed female screams mix with distorted yelps, electro-buzzes and in-the-red drum beats (those hi-hats'll drive you mad).
